file_content.text: You have exceeded all expectations. Thank you.
We must regain control of the Sith Academy. Glory for the Empire!
Your shuttle to Tython awaits.
The Republic's been flushed from the Sith Academy, and their Commander Jensyn is dead.
If I could carry a tune, I would sing of this day. What we are about to accomplish, the galaxy will forever behold with great wonderment.
But perhaps I'm getting ahead of myself. After all, we've never properly met.
Darth Arkous.
Yes. A pleasure. In my capacity as Minister of Military Offense, I have repeatedly enjoyed the fruits of your labor.
And this is my most trusted advisor, Lana Beniko.
So much strength I sense in you. After all the trials you've endured, to stand here now is quite an achievement.
The value of a great mind cannot be measured. The Dark Council is no doubt all the better for your involvement.
The hunt. The fateful moment. Then victory. It's no wonder you've chosen your particular path.
Secrets. They are windows, doors and walls, all at once. You lead a complicated life.
I sense such strong convictions. Each of you a great power to be reckoned with.
And I sense someone who's more than a little taken with me.
[Flirt] Like what you see?
Do not presume to know me--unless you'd like a sample of my power.
Careful with the familiarity.
Perhaps we could discuss my finer qualities at some point in the near future, under less formal circumstances.
[Flirt] What are you doing later?
You must think me gullible to serve up such empty flattery.
Do not patronize me.
Maybe you'd like to go on a hunt with me sometime.
[Flirt] Want to know more?
I'm here to get paid. That's all there is to it.
Less reflection, more credits.
I'm open to sharing more of myself if you are.
[Flirt] You have my attention.
There's nothing you can tell me about myself that I don't already know.
Drop the assessment.
You see me well. The Force teems within you.
You are strong with the Force.
What can I say? You've got me pegged. Not bad.
Rather astute.
As we've only just met, that remains to be seen, Wrath.
I meant no offense. Perhaps we should get to the matter at hand.
Perhaps we could, Dark Lord--at some point, as you say.
I confess I do enjoy a good chase now and then. We could discuss it later.
I might be persuaded. A discussion for another time.
And it always has. I'm fortunate in that regard.
As in all things, it is the Force that guides me.
You've been invited here to perform an act once thought impossible: an attack on the Jedi Temple of Tython.
Promising leads have been rare ever since Imperial Intelligence was effectively dismantled. However, a source I personally trust has alerted me to a hole in Tython's planetary defenses.
If we act fast and strike hard, it will absolutely ruin Republic morale. Annihilate it.
If wealth is your goal, you won't be disappointed.
And once we've taken the Temple? What then?
While you concern yourself with the assault, Lord Goh will be tasked with keeping the Temple secured.
So long as we have control, we'll explore the artifacts and histories stored inside. Imagine all we can learn about the Jedi and the Force.
This will be a great day for the Sith--and the Sith Empire.
I'm sold.
Does Lord Goh have anything to say about any of this, or is he mute?
Why doesn't Goh talk?
We should raze the Temple. Let everything and everyone inside it smolder and turn to ash.
Burn it. Burn it all.
The Force isn't exactly my thing.
Ugh, not the Force....
The more we discover, the better equipped the Empire will be in future endeavors.
Information is power.
Hey, if knowing that stuff keeps my number one employer flush with credits, I'm all for it.
What's good for the Empire....
Precisely, Commander--if you don't mind my use of the title.
Such information would be a great boon to the Sith.
Yes, indeed.
The longer we hold the Jedi Temple, the deeper the wound to the Republic's morale, and the longer it will take them to recover.
Yes, understood. That, of course, is why we intend to pay you for your services in lieu of scholarly wealth.
Of course. I do hope you consider what that information would do for the Sith Empire as a whole.
That it will, lord Wrath.
Your shuttle awaits. By the time you reach Tython, our first wave will have established a foothold on the surface. I'll remain in constant contact throughout the offensive.
Succeed in this and together we will have signaled the beginning of the Republic's most humiliating end. Glory for the Empire!
Lord Goh prefers to speak through actions rather than words. In that regard, he's a flawless communicator.
You have served the Empire with strength and passion. I applaud you.
Before he died, Commander Jensyn made a comment about having "served his purpose."
The Jedi said something....
Anything else requiring my attention? Has the Republic attacked any more Imperial targets?
What now?
What do you say we take some time to mark the occasion?
[Flirt] Care to celebrate, Arkous?
No, I think they've realized that their reach has exceeded their grasp.
He did? Almost makes it sound as though the Republic sacrificed all those forces in support of some ulterior motive....
A tempting offer. The offense minister's work is never done, I'm afraid.
Listen--I want to be sure you understand that what you've accomplished--both on Korriban and on Tython--will be long remembered.
Everyone will look back on these days as the nascent events that framed a new foundation for the galaxy. They will see those who participated as its architects.
If you need any further participation, you know where to find me.
Always glad to be of service.
Have you taken Lord Goh's vow of silence or whatever that was?
Nothing to say, Lana?
Do you think you could stop making speeches at me?
Dial down the rhetoric.
I'm reflecting on the day's events. As Darth Arkous has said, your contributions thus far have been most impressive.
When the time comes, there will be no hesitation. That's a promise.
Mm. It's become a habit, I'm afraid. Comes from years of speaking to the easily led and the utterly stupid. You, of course, are neither.
Lana and I are indebted to you for your exemplary actions in the Empire's name. We thank you.
Yes, thank you. I do hope we have the chance to speak again. Preferably soon.
Glory for the Empire.
The Jedi Temple is now in Imperial hands.
Indeed it is. All thanks to your efforts, of course.
At this very moment, Lord Goh's team is exploring a hidden chamber rumored to hold the Jedi's most treasured secrets.
Better still, the Republic will be reeling right now, stupefied over the humiliation you've wrought.
My lord.
Sergeant Tarsten, do you not see that I have company? Important company?
Of-of course, my lord. But I've a report from--from Korriban. It seems--the Republic, my lord, they....
Try taking a breath, Sergeant.
Relax, then speak.
Spit it out. [Threaten him]
[Remain silent]
Say something of meaning, unless you'd like me to choke it out of you.
Yes. Yes, you're right. My apologies....
Unless you're a fan of blaster fire, you'd better start forming complete sentences.
The Republic has attacked the Sith Academy!
Oh, get to the point, Tarsten, or so help me....
What? A retaliation so soon? What's the present status?
It's done. They've taken the Academy. Secured it. And reports indicate that Darth Soverus... gave his life in its defense.
I see.... Leave us.
Darth Soverus made a fine addition to the Dark Council. We should all strive to be as loyal to the end.
Ready the shuttle for departure. I'm going to Korriban.
We must reclaim the Academy.
Wouldn't the Republic have been better off trying to reclaim the Jedi Temple?
Why Korriban, and not Tython?
Never mind Soverus.
The loss of a fellow Dark Council member is not exactly a pressing matter just now, Arkous.
This isn't the time to get sentimental. We've got work ahead of us.
Darths die. We need to focus on what's happening now.
It's a perplexing matter, but we can't concern ourselves with it now.
Yes, I'm aware.
As you say, Wrath....
Republic forces have made landfall on Korriban and sacked the Sith Academy.
At this very moment, Jedi walk the halls of our Sith Academy. Our Dark Council Chambers. Simply outrageous!
You're eager. Good. We need eager.
Yes. Yes, we do.
I'm going to coordinate with our forces on Korriban, ensure you have a safe place to land as near the Academy as possible.
As with Tython, I will remain in close contact with you throughout the operation.
A final note: whoever is heading Republic operations on Korriban must be made an example of. Do not take their command lead prisoner.
May the Force favor you this day.
Yes. The Force be with you, and with the great Sith Empire.
Indeed it would, Dark Lord.
Then we're agreed, Hunter. Good.
